title: Nagorno-Karabakh
summary: Nagorno-Karabakh (/nəˈɡɔːrnoʊ kɑːrəˈbɑːk/ nə-GOR-noh kar-ə-BAHK;[3] Russian: Нагорный Карабах, romanized: Nagorny Karabakh, lit. 'mountainous Karabakh'; Armenian: Լեռնային Ղարաբաղ, romanized: Leṙnayin Ġarabaġ, listen ; Azerbaijani: Dağlıq Qarabağ, listen  or Yuxarı Qarabağ, listen ) is a landlocked region in the South Caucasus, within the mountainous range of Karabakh, lying between Lower Karabakh and Syunik, and covering the southeastern range of the Lesser Caucasus mountains. The region is mostly mountainous and forested.
